level.text: The following penalties may be imposed in addition to those otherwise available at law:
Any telephone solicitor who violates any provision of this subchapter may be fined up to $1,000 per violation.
A permit or license shall be revoked or suspended if the seller or telephone solicitor fails to comply with the registration requirements of this subchapter.
A judge may impose treble damages against any telephone solicitor who knowingly targets elderly persons or persons with disabilities.
Fines shall be payable to the Fraud Prevention Fund established in § 22- 3226.14.

level.heading: Effect of Amendments
level.text: D.C. Law 16-305, in subsec. (a)(3), substituted "persons or persons with disabilities" for "or disabled persons".

level.heading: Legislative History of Laws
level.text: Law 16-305, the "People First Respectful Language Modernization Act of 2006", was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 16-664, which was referred to Committee on the Whole. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on June 20, 2006, and July 11, 2006, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on July 17, 2006, it was assigned Act No. 16-437 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review. D.C. Law 16-305 became effective on April 24, 2007.
